title: UDL Application Strategies for Designing Online Mathematics Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience in using online learning tools
context.additional_context: Environment combining job-linked math concepts with project-based assessment for job seekers, requiring multi-device compatibility in BYOD settings

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish at least three types of math learning materials applying UDL principles (alternative means, engagement, multiple means of expression) in online environments.
Learners can explain four priority types for UDL application by analyzing Q-sort survey results.
Learners can produce artifacts that visually, textually, and aurally represent mathematical problems in diverse formats aligned with project-based assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
